Posts.Content: I have my op coming up two weeks today. I have to have a rt total mastectomy, axillary gland clearance and I have chosen to have immediate reconstruction using the LD muscle from my back. They tell me I could be home as early as day 3 or 4 if I can manage the drains at home. Part of me is being quite level-headed about it and thinking well, it's the next big step in my treatment and a step toward getting my life back. The other part of me is terrified! I'm told 15% chance of lymphoedema - which scares me a bit. Then there'll be 15 consecutive days of radiotherapy. Some of the stuff I have read on here has been quite scary . I know these forums are often for sharing problems -and that's ok - but has anyone had a straightforward experience and is managing ok?
Posts.Title: Surgery coming up next - any straightforward experiences of LD reconstruction...
